_Education_
------------------------------------------------------------------------


Maya Spaur is a PhD student in the Environmental Health Sciences department at Columbia Mailman School of Public Health, located in New York, NY.

She completed her Master of Science (ScM) in Environmental Health & Engineering at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health in Baltimore, MD, in 2019. She has a Certificate in Risk Sciences & Public Policy from JHSPH, as well as a Certificate in Quantitative Microbial Risk Assessment (QMRA) from the QMRA Interdisciplinary Instructional Institute.

She completed a B.S. in Environmental Science & Technology with a concentration in Environmental Health, and a B.A. in Government & Politics, at the University of Maryland in College Park, MD, in 2017.

* National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Hollings Scholar intern for Dr. Suzanne Bricker. May - Aug 2016.
